114.title: Studing the remains of the Dazzlings' neckl...

1142.content: Twilight looked to the small pieces of red that lined the table, then to the large piece that was broken. Ever since the defeat of the Dazzlings, Twilight had taken it upon herself to figure out the odd source of their magic. At the risk of word spreading, she didn't even think of telling anyone about it. "Come on..." she thought as she picked up the last two pieces, ".... all my work for this one moment...." She had to do this slowly, the slightest movement could set the pieces in the wrong place. As carefully as possible, Twilight dropped the pieces into what she believed was their right place. For a moment, nothing happened. Then a flash of red blew forward as the necklace lost it's cracks. Twilight tried her hardest to contain her excitement, even though she had pretty much fixed a weapon of evil. Looking into the gem, she saw her reflection as it smiled back at her. Holding it up to the moonlight, a slight gleam of red and gold came across her face...... then the idea came. Twilight didn't know why she wanted to do it, but she was. Checking the strap to face sure it was tight enough, she slowly placed it around her neck. She looked at herself in the mirror and posed, a strange grin coming to her face..... a strange evil grin.

114221.content: Twilight stood by her bed and prepared to get her P.J's on. Before she started however, she wanted to take one last look at her new accessory. Luckily, the table she had put it on was her homework table she had in her bedroom. She looked at it and smiled to herself at a job well done. She was about to turn away when she noticed the gems color had changed from red to purple. "Okay.... that's odd." Before she could pick it up, an odd purple mist emanated from it and began heading for her. "And that is not good!" Before Twilight could do anything however, the mist encircled her and obscured her vision. She opened her mouth to scream, but just as she did the mist began to flow into. She kept screaming, until she noticed it was slowly changing. It was becoming music, and it was becoming more enchanting and mesmerizing as more mist flowed in. "This must be how those three felt when they became sirens."Twilight thought as the song she was now singing drove her eyes down. She knew what was happening and felt like she should be freaking out, yet she felt happy about this. The song kept her calm. Although it had no lyrics, she knew what it was, it was a song of comfort, a song of power.... and submitting to it. By the time the mist had disappeared, she was softly singing herself to sleep. Before she closed her eyes, she looked over to her necklace and smiled. "Tomorrow, I'll test how strong I am."

142.content:
Rarity layed on her bed,looking over the pictures of her friends. Her mind thought over her personal ideas of them.

"Twilight:Calm and reserved, tries to be a good friend and does so quite well. Pinkie Pie: Wonder at cheering a friend up, though the dear can be loud and sometimes undignified, but it's far better then her 'other' side. Fluttershy: The poor dear is often afraid of her own shadow, but she is certainly a proper lady otherwise. Applejack: She is quite undignifed and can be a brute if she wants. However that is mainly due to her upbringing and she is able to hold it down. Rainbow Dash......."
Rarity stopped at the picture of RD as her head filled with what aspects of a true lady RD had. In her opinon, that was nothing. "Not a single thing that the poor dear does could possibly be considered befitting a lady....or female at least." Rarity huffed and turned over in her bed. "If only there was someway that I could show that girl how to behave." She reached over to her nightstand, grabbing a perfume bottle. She gave herself a few squirts, breathing in the wonderful scent. After sighing with relaxation, she stopped. She looked to the bottle for a moment, then got off the couch. She opened the doors of her closet, seeing a large multitude of dresses that she created over the month. A dark grin began to creep on her face as the gears in her head began to turn. Rarity knew she had magic in her, maybe it was time to see how she could use it personally.

(A few days later)

The bell signalling the end of school rang out loud. Rarity watched as students wandered the halls, looking for her target. Sure enough, she was right by the water fountain. Rarity was certain Rainbow did not have soccer practice today, so there was certainly no risks of interuption. Rarity giggled as she thought, "Once I'm done with her, she'll probably quit the team just to learn from me." "Hey Rarity." RD said when she noticed her friend, "Whats up?" "Well darling, I was wondering if you could.....come over to my house." Rarity mentally kicked herself for her hesitation, but Rainbow didn't seem to notice. "Sure, I could do with a little girl-to-girl time. Let's get going." As the two started heading out of school and to Rarity's, Rarity tried to figure out what to do. Through her days of work at home, she had managed to make two special things to 'help' RD. She had made both a special perfume and an enchanted dress. The question was...what to try first?

1512.content:
The bright moon was reflected off the small pond, giving an extra dose of calm to Fluttershy as she walked down the path. She held her night bag in a somewhat tight fashion on her left shoulder while she felt her phone in her left hand. The girls had arranged for a sleepover and Applejack was the winner of Pinkie's straw picking. This decision would have been okay with Fluttershy if it wasn't for the fact that her work at the shelter was busier than usual today. It was already nighttime by the time someone took her shift and only got darker when she reached her house. For the sake of her friends though, Fluttershy knew she had to brave the dark of night. It really didn't seem like much of a problem, the orchard wasn't too far off and what animals were found along the path were usually friendly. So there she was, walking along the grass in the darkness. The path was right in front of her and lights from the house could already be seen.

*squeak*

"Hmmm..?" Fluttershy stopped at the sound.

*squeak squeak..*

"Oh my....who's there?" Fluttershy looked around for the source of the pained squeaking, her head turning about until she saw a slightly rustling bush. She creeped over to the bush and saw a sight quite painful to her. A small bat laid in the grass with a seemingly sprained foot. "Oh my goodness, come here you poor thing." Fluttershy carefully picked up the wounded mammal and cradled it as lightly as possible in her arms. "Don't worry, everything's gonna be fine. I'm always prepared for this." Reaching into her bag, Fluttershy pulled out two popsicle sticks, presterilized and ready for splint usage. However, it seemed her little 'friend' wasn't quite so innocent. For the moment she turned her back, the faking bat sprung towards the girl's neck and bit deep. Fluttershy felt a little light headed as the creature worked it's feeding before flying off into the night. The bite would have meant little if the Equestrian magic in the girl began having an odd reaction to the bite. She began to feel dizzy, the world spun as a strange pain entered her mouth. "No....what......ughhh....hisss...."
1512.title: EG: Flutterbat's beginnings

Besides, I haven't seen anything in this world that would even compare to the danger back home." With that, Twilight closed the door behind her and left the girls wondering what to do now. "Do you think that maybe we should follow her?" "Well, ah trust Twilight enough that she can HEY!!!!" "Ha ha ha, I win again Applejack!"

Twilight shivered as she walked out into the orchard, thinking that maybe she should have put her regular clothes back on. However, she was not going back and worrying her friends. Plus, it was still a little hard adjusting to furless skin and needing clothes instead of just using them as decoration. A few dead leaves crunched beneath her feet as she walked down the path. The moon shone through the trees, creating ghastly shadows along the ground and around the other trees. With Pinkie's "Giggle at the Ghosties" song in her head, Twilight kept her fear at bay. At least she could until something else came along.........

hiss....Twilight....
The voice sounded close, and yet it was so soft one might mistake it for being far away. Twilight turned around, unsure of where the sounds were coming from. "Who's there? Show yourself." Twilight's voice attempted to show bravery but anyone could tell she was startled. Twilight.... This time, the voice was definitely closer and more identifiable. As it sounded a third time, Twilight looked up to the trees where she was certain she heard it. What she saw froze her in her tracks, silhouetted against the moonlight and hanging off a tree branch was a figure. Even in the moon's light it took a second to recognize it. When it unfolded it's wings and showed it's whole self however, then Twilight knew what it was. Her hair was ruffled and split and her clothes were slightly torn and dirty. As she took to the air, her grace was evident and her razor canines reflected the red in her eyes. "F..Fl...Flutterbat...." As the being landed softly on the ground, she gave a 'come hither' motion. "Twilight....hiss...come here...."

1521.content:
Even before the sun had risen up, there was the feeling of disaster in the air. It started with a frog croaking in a wrong note due to a sore throat. This sour note created a ripple in the small pond the frog sat on. This ripple spread out in a square pattern, confusing and frighting a small flock of ducks on the shore. The upset ducklings waddled to a nearby tree, their mother loudly honking in protest. This honking awoke a squirrel one minute before it normally did. Enraged, the squirrel took one of the hardest nuts it could find a tossed it down at the noisemakers. This acorn missed the target and began rolling along the hillside. The acorn passed under a raccoon, whose paw broke the nut open while tripping the raccoon. This raccoon believed a snake was underfoot and darted towards the nearest shelter. This shelter just so happened to be in a trashcan which unfortunately was already taken by another rac coon. As the two fought, rubbish in the trashcan began to fly out and roll down the pavement. One particular piece of newspaper caught the eye of a bluebird, who picked it up and soared high into the sky. The bird swallowed the paper, not realizing it was about to enter a struggle for air it wouldn't win. As the bird squirmed, a single feather came off and blew around in the air. This feather floated through town on that disaster filled air until it reached Sugar cube corner. The window was open and the feather was blown in. Lightly, ever so gently, it landed into the tufts of pink hair belonging to one Pinkie Pie. That one feather, charged with all of negitivity passed to it, was about to become the undoing of life as Canterlot High knew it.

The alarm on Pinkie's bed jingled a soft, harmonious tune....which was met with an oversized hammer whamming it into pieces. Pinkie's eyes twitched in anger as her fluffy hair deflated. Her light and happy demeanor was nowhere in sight as she stomped out of bed. She looked in a mirror for a slight second, no speck of happy ness on her. "I'm....in....a bad mood." She growled as she grabbed her bag and headed out, both a light sucking aura and her outside clothes appearing out of nowhere.

15211.content:
On a normal day, the colors of the town would have brought a joyous smile to Pinkie's face that would turn into a musical number. Today however, all Pinkie did was grumble and growl at the annoying happiness around her. She knew full well this feeling would only get worse when she would reach school. "There's just got to be a way to get rid of all that stupid happy dopey cheer...." As the near colorless girl barged by an electronics window, her ears perked up over an old movie on the TV.

We jerks only take NO for an awsner. Is that understood Matt?!

Pinkie begrudgingly looked, remembering what was playing. This was a scene from a movie about this band called the Weasels where the Little Green Jerks were readying the troops. Pinkie's eyes glossed over the different creatures in the group, each with their own way of destroying happiness and joy. The dark gears in the bad mooded Pinkie turned in perfection. She and her friends had some interesting magic, with the right motivation for each....the shadowy aura around Pinkie grew as she hurried to school. "Today....Canterlot High goes Blue-ey."
15211.title: Where's the inspiration from? Come on and guess!

Pinkie finds AJ and plans for her
152111.content:
As Canterlot High came into Pinkie's view, so too did a girl she had already planned to meet. Rainbow Days was by the door practicing her drill kicking for soccer. "Alright Dashie..." Pinkie whispered in a venom filled tone. "your my first target whether you like it or not." As Pinkie came into her view, Rainbow waved over to her. "Hey Pinks! How's it..wow...did you loose blood or something? Look at your color!" Pinkie fashioned a smile as she steppes closer to her friend. "Oh forget about me Dashie, look at you! You and your perfect muscles and beautifully built body." While still curious over her friend's coloration, Rainbow's chest puffed in pride over the complement. "Well thanks, Pinkie. I guess I am pretty hot." The dark aura around Pinkie pulsed and stretched slightly. "Of course you are, and your soooo talented. I mean...who else in this school is both an amazing guitar player, singer, and athlete?" Rainbow opened her mouth to speak, but Pinkie cut her off. "No one. You're the only one. Certainly no one is as amazing as you and your many talents." The darkness was creeping closer and closer, inches away from the pride filled Dash yet stopping cold. "Well, I don't know if I'm the only amazing..." "But I insist Rainbow!" Pinkie blurted as she got right up to Dash's face. "Your the best around, better than anyone else in this whole school and you know it." Pilling out a gold medal and placing it upon Dash, the prideful athleate gave a chuckle. "Well, I just might be."

Rainbow shivered as the dark aura engulfed her, that final sentence giving it the chance it needed. Rainbow felt so cold....yet so alive. Her mind seemed to blank out as her hair started to grey out. "That's right Rainbow. You are the best and only you are the best. You need to make that clear to everyone. Always let them know how awesome you are and how pathetic they are compared to you. They may call it bragging, but it's just the truth. Am I right?" As her body joined in greying out, the cocky grin of Rainbow flashed in a bleak corrupted version of itself. "Yeah! I am the best! Why the heck am I letting all the losers in school off for thinking they're even half as cool as me." "Such a position is only reserved for me and your friends, and even then it isn't enough." With a primal roar of self worth, Rainbow rushed into school, her body giving off it's own dark aura."Now...my other friends just need a similar yet different push...."

1521111.content:
As the bells rang and students began to trickle into school, the new Pinkie and Rainbow Dash began to let their new mindsets loose. Rainbow was going through the halls, showing off her skills with a soccer ball or her medals which she proudly wore. "Go ahead, look at them." She sneered to Truce, "It's about as close as you'll ever get to being even a fraction of my awesomeness." The dark aura around Rainbow would use the victim's hurt feelings and lowered self-worth to drain the happiness from them, turning into basically depressed zombies. Pinkie....well...think of it like her average self but instead of making fun, she's crushing it.

Sunset looked to the student's around her and squinted at the differences. There were the normal ones...but then there were those that seemed a little....off" some were feeling sorry about themselves while other were agitated and cranky looking, and they all had a disturbing shade of grey to them. It didn't take a genius to tell Sunset there was magic involved in all of this. She had to tell her friends and possibly Principal Celestial and Vice Principal Luna would be able to help somehow.

15211112.content: As much as Sunset needed to tell the others about all of this, something within her said the principals needed to be checked up on. Without a moment of hesitation, Sunset made her way through the half average half bleak halls of the school. Along the way, her eyes fell upon Rainbow Dash who just slammed Snowflake to the ground to show off her strength. Sunset reached the office and quickly entered in. "Principal Celestial, I think something wrong is happening to the school. Students have been acting so strange and....and..." Sunset's eye twinged as she saw a greyed out Celestial sitting calmly at her desk. "Please Miss Shimmer, have a seat before you continue. You seem quite exhausted." "Uhhhh...actually...I think I may have been overreacting...let me just...." Before Sunset's hand could grasp the doorknob again, a grey hand took hold." Sunset looked to the hand and saw Vice Principal Luna giving her a strange smile. "Please Miss Shimmer. We insist." Sunset gulped, realizing she might not have a lot of options at the moment. Begrudgingly, she followed Luna's pull until she was sitting in front of Celestia's desk. "Now Miss Shimmer. Before we begin on your problems, we actually have something to discuss with you. You see, Pinkie Pie came into the office before school and gave us an interesting speech. She went on and on about all you girls have done for the school and well...she has mentioned your powers on occasion." Celestial got up from her seat while Luna continued. "You see, we have decided that you all deserve more than just being simple high schoolers. In fact, we think you all deserve to be..." Both sisters leaned close to Sunset as they whispered "Exempt from the rules." Sunset shivered with how they said those words and was already thinking of an exit strategy. "Think of it Sunset, being able to do whatever you want within school grounds. Canter lot High would be a big sandbox for you all to play around in. And we would be happy to revel in making you all happy." The entire conversation making Sunset uncomfortable as all hell now, all she could do was say. "What about the other student?" Celestial chuckled. "What about them? It's not like they matter compared to you and your friends. In fact, this will only let them know how worthless they are compared to you." Sunset repeatedly looked to the door, about to make a mad dash to tell the girls about this horror. "Now Miss Sunset...why don't you just let us make you...pleased?'

She grumbled to herself as she made her way up the stairs to the school door. Right as Pinkie was about to grasp the door with her darkly colored hand, she heard something whizzing through the air. She caught the object in question, a soccer ball, just before it hit her head. "Who did this?!" The girl turned around to see none other then Rainbow Dash running towards her. "Pinkie! Thank you so much for catching that! I kicked that ball way too hard and....uhhh....you okay?" Pinkie walked very slowly over to Rainbow, a look of unforgiving annoyance etched on her face. The two were soon face to face, the cold aura now wrapping itself around Rainbow. Pinkie held the ball up to the annoying one's face and with one swift motion, popped the ball. The color on Rainbow Dash began to drain as Pinkie dropped the deflated ball at their feet. Without a word, Pinkie stomped her way into school, leaving the colorless Rainbow in a strange pool of depression. "Suddenly I don't feel like kicking this anyway." An emotionless Rainbow said as she sat down. "Or standing.....or sitting..." The depressed, colorless girl now just played there, the first victim of Pinki's contagious bad mood.

"I'm preaty sure that there's enough for each of you." The girls each reached in and each pulled out caps excatly like the one Fluttershy was holding. Rarity looked to the cap and tried to smile. "I must say Sunlight... this certainly is.....good." "Don't worry." Glimmer said "I didn't need to over exert myself. I'm no better at sewing than anyone else." Her smile seemed to droop as she continued "Though you seem to think of yourself as better at that though." Rarity nervously chuckled "I don't mean to brag but..." "Of course you don't." Glimmer said scowling "Thats what they all say. You think that sugarcoating your words with that means you don't want to hurt others." Grabbing the bag, even though there was nothing in it, she stormed off. "Well that was rude." Rarity said as she tossed the hat to the table. "You said it Rarity." RD said, doing likewise. Fluttershy watched as the girls each tossed thier caps. She looked to Glimmer and saw that she was sitting alone. She looked to the cap she had grabbed and grabbed the other hats. "I'll just take these....somewhere." Making sure the others weren't watching, she walked over to Glimmer. "I'm sorry about the others." Glimmer looked to Fluttershy and put her head down. "I should have guessed it was a mistake. No one would listen to me before, and no one will now." Smiling softly, Fluttershy put a cap on Glimmer's head. "I'm listening." Glimmer looked up to see Fluttershy was putting on her own cap. "I don't want to be scared around others." Glimmer smiled as she saw the sign on the cap was glowing. "Don't worry." she said, "You just need to learn to blend in."

153311121111122221121122.content:
"How about downstairs?" Twilight asked as she looked to Fluttershy. Glimmer turned towards on of the doors in the hallway and said "Certainly that's where my room is anyways, follow me." The two followed her as she went down the stairs, Fluttershy more eager than Twilight. Twilight looked to the walls and noticed that the walls were painted in an uninteresting tan. Twilight couldn't help but shake her head, even she would have picked a better color than this. Then again..... it just meant that it wouldn't have as much attention as the rest of the house. Twilight froze, the second she thought this, a strange vibe went through her body. It wasn't a painful feeling, but a strange dull feeling that seemed to take energy from her. Having a bad feeling, Twilight drove that thought from her head and keep walking.

"Here we are." Glimmer said as she smiled, "My little hideaway in the house." The two girls looked to the room in curiosity, pictures of equal signs dotted the room with equal space between. The bed wasn't anything to extravagant, but also wasn't too shabby. Twilight felt across it and noticed the not too soft feel of it. "Makes sense." she thought "You wouldn't want to be too comfortable." Twilight could feel the dullness go through her and could also see Fluttershy's cap glow. Pulling her eyes away from the equal sign covered bed covers, she looked to Glimmer who was grabbing what appeared to be a music player. "Would you like to listen to a little music? I have something I think you'll both equally enjoy." At the thought of such music, Twilight could feel the dullness getting stronger. "That would be wonderful Glimmer." Fluttershy said in an even blander tone than before. Glimmer smiled as she pushed the play button. The three simply sat as a strange mix of instruments began to play out. "I made this myself to help remind me of equality's beauty." Glimmer said as she laid back, "It's not too good though." "That's okay Glimmer." Fluttershy said as the smile on her face got wider, "You're no better at music than me." Twilight couldn't help but nod and could feel the dullness getting stronger as she did. Unlike before however, the dullness felt....comforting. As the music kept playing, Twilight could feel herself slipping, falling deeper into a sense of happiness equal to what Fluttershy was no doubt feeling.

153311121111122221121122222212.content: Twilight kept running, the thoughts of what Glimmer was doing running through her head. "I have to stop her, we have to stop her." she thought as she ran. "She doesn't fool me with that innocent act, I know what she's planning. She's gonna force the students to play in her sick equality fantasy." She kept running for a moment until she stopped dead in her tracks. She felt something odd, it almost felt like...... she shook her head, believing it to be nothing. She tried to get back to running, although she seemed to have slowed down. "I can almost tell exactly how it's gonna happen. It'll start with all the talk about equality and how everyone should be equal in skill. She'd plaster that smile Fluttershy had on everyone." Her run was beginning to slow down to a jog. "She'd bring the principals into her plans and no doubt put a dress code into effect." The thought of so many students dressed in the exact same clothes....nothing out of place or better looking than others. "GahHH!" Twilight internally screamed as she stopped again and held her head. "The cap is gone.... how is the thought of equality making me feel like this?" Just by thinking the word, Twilight could feel the dull feeling the cap gave her. She kept fighting the thoughts, thought the more she tried to not think about giving in, the more it became an option. "No one would be different. No one would be laughed at, feel insecure about themselves, or be without friends. Because they would be the same...everyone would be EQUAL." A smile grew on Twilight as she began to feel her urges of individuality fade away, replaced by a need for equality. She turned and began to walk back to Sunlight's house, making sure to not seem in more a hurry than anyone else on the street.

A deadly silence came through the room, penetrated only through footsteps the girls assumed were Glimmer's. From her position by the door, Applejack looked through the keyhole to see what was up.

Glimmer waked around the two principals, who seemed frozen in place. She looked back to the door with a scowl. "Let me ask you something, who do you think would bother to listen to me? I was lucky that your friend Fluttershy was kind enough to give me a chance, but even then I had to do it. It's been engrained in our nature to be superior then others, a drive to set up barriers and make ourselves seem special." Glimmer's smile returned she looked to the equal mark tattoos on her. "I realized that such a thought process needed to go, and there was only one option." Glimmer took another walk around the principals, noticing they were trying to fight the magic keeping them as statues. "You four are lucky, you get to witness just how much I've prepared for making equality to reign at this school." "Oh yeah?!" RD said as Glimmer pulled a small music player from her pocket, "Just what is that supposed to mean?" Glimmer walked up to the door to make sure they could hear her. "Twilight and Fluttershy told me some very interesting facts about you all. About certain magical properties you hold. While the girls are now sickened at how unequal their powers make them, they were happy to use them to help. I now have different variations of my wonderful equality-based clothes. The caps I've now placed on Celestia and Luna keep them still as statues, but quite receptive to the voices of those who have embraced equality. Recorded or otherwise." Glimmer clicked the play button on her music player and sat it down on the desk. "It'll take a few seconds for it to start, but it will be quite a nice presentation. I'll leave you four to simmer with them. I'm certain no one outside these conveniently near-soundproof walls. Who knows, you all might find it easier to accept equality." Glimmer headed for the door out but before she did, she said one more thing before leaving. "Just to give you one last piece of info, if your friends wear the equality caps and clothes long enough, they won't need continuous conditioning to accept equality anymore."

The girls heard the door close before they heard a recorded message assumingly from whatever Glimmer had planned. To put it simply, it was quite loud.

Equality is true happiness

You're no better then anyone else

All are Equal

Individualism is a lie

Equality is true perfection

It jus kept going, the girls now trying desperately to get out of the closet. "We have to stop her!" Rarity cried out. "Personally," Applejack said as she banged against the door, "just stopping that recording is good enough to me. It's already annoying!"

153321.content:
The fall formal was... interesting, to say the least. The big thing everyone was talking about was Sunset Shimmer going evil and hypnotizing the entire school! This git you interested. What would happen if you decided to hypnotize someone yourself..?
After getting a locket from a shady man in a flea market, you decide to test it out. You hypnotize a random girl to stand still.
"It works," you thought, unhypnotizing the poor girl, leaving her confused.
The next day at school, you decide you need to find a victim.
"But who?" you ask yourself, Karna's Principal Celestia walks by.
"The Principal!" you think. Opening the locket, the stream of magic seems to know where to go as it hypnotizes Principal Celestia.
Now, you could drive her home, where you two would he alone, but you could also keep her here, where, if you wanted, could embarrass her big time.
What will you do?
153321.title: Celestia

1533212.content: Do you want to keep on this path or do you want a different idea?
1533212.title: A quick decision to make

15332122.content: How about this idea: After coming to the realization of what power the Equestrian Twilight has, Principal Celestial takes it upon to herself to keep the girl here...and maybe by her side.
15332122.title: Principal Celestial 2

choices: Find how Sunset communicates with Twilight
153321221.content:
It was near the end of the school day and Principal Celestial was having a few previous moments of downtime. No papers to check over, no troublemakers needing a talk, nothing to do at all. Taking a moment to reach under her desk, she pulled out a yearbook from a year or so ago and looked over it. "Hmm....my my...these students just never change do they?....Hmm." Celestia's eyes stopped at a specific picture near the end of the book. It was a photo of her handing the Fall Formal crown to..."Twilight..."
That night, that magical unusual night. The night when everything Celestia knew was thrown into question. Sunset's little hypnotic light show, Twilight and her friends stopping her....it was just all so extravagant. Of course she had to let the princess leave for home, but all that power inside her. Just the thought of it all bubbled emotions the principal hadn't felt since the Dazzlings had hypnotized her and her sister. "All of that magic, such a student here would change everything. Plus, as unprofessional as it may seem, there was something about that Twilight...just....." Celestia shivered "No...keep those thoughts away.....for now." However, there was no doubt in her mind, the next time that pony princess came through would be the last time she'd ever leave. The only problem was how to do it. She had nothing to bring Twilight under her sway and nothing to help her find anything. Plus, she would need a reason for Twilight to come here so as to not look suspicious when she 'decides' to stay. Her eyes turned to the window thinking until they meet the body of Sunset, happily walking through the halls to her locker. It seemed those two parts weren't true.
153321221.title: Perfect Choice

choices: Agree to teach, but keep and eye on her
She's hiding something, ask some questions
1533212212.content:
With a sinister smirk, Celestia pushed her intercom button. If Sunset Shimmer is still in the building, would you please come to the principal's office? Repeat, would Sunset Shimmer please come to my office." Within the span of a few seconds, Sunset walked right in. "I was just about to leave, what's up Celestia?" Celestial put on her best worried look and took a deep breath. "Sunset....I need to ask you something. You see, I've been thinking over some of the incidences that have happened here in the past. Mostly the Dazzlings issue but still, if my sister and I were prepaired for such hypnotic powers the problems that followed would not have happened. Don't you agree?" Sunset shot a questioning glance but nodded all the same. "Well, I was thinking....Could it be possible for you to teach me such magics, with you yourself being so powerful it should be no trouble to give me a few pointers?"

Sunset's questioning glance stayed put as her mind rushed about. "Why in the world is Principal Celestial going on about this now? If it was really so important, she would have asked me about this sooner. However, I can't pretend she doesn't have a point.....but...something's just not right...."
1533212212.title: Call Sunset into the office

choices: The two head home and the test begins
15332122121.content:
Eventually, Sunset decided she had no present reason to suspect Celestial of any harmful intentions. However, there was still something about all of this she didn't find right. "Well...I can't teach you direct magic seeing as you are truly human. However, I can give you a few tips to recognize and defend yourself from being hypnotized. You should probably bring Luna in so she can learn this too." Celestia chuckled at the student's remark. "Don't worry Sunset, I'll make sure my sister is aware of these lessons later." The suspicion in Sunset was still alive, especially after that statement as she she began to tell Principal Celestia what she knew.

Celestia took out a small pad of paper and noted down notes as Sunset began to talk about the many types of hypnosis she knew about. Celestia internally grinned as Sunset explained almost anything could be used as a hypnotic item if used right. She gave precise details on the usual stances a hypnotist took in planning and when to assume the worst. As the conversation continued, Celestia also took note of the many ways hypnotism could be avoided and even broken. While the myriad troubled her, she realized these would be good for future reference.

As Sunset continued on the topic of ways to break hypnosis, her eyes darted once more to Celestia's rather quick note taking. The more she wanted to believe the principal's good intentions, the more it seemed there were other intentions. "...dominion. Well...I think that's all I can tell you. Although I don't see why you needed to ask me about all of this." Celestial chuckled once again as she flipped through her well-taken notes. "Trust me Sunset, you've done more help then you realize. Now run along and have fun with your friends." Celestial kept a pleasant smile as Sunset quickly made her way out of the office. "Hmm...if I know that girl, I think I added just enough of a suspicion to my words. She's probably going to get Twilight's attention right now." Putting the notebook in her pocket, Celestia turned to the door of her sister's office. "It might be best if I test my knowledge on my sister first."
15332122121.title: Agree to teach, but keep and eye on her

choices: The next day: Twilight comes from the mirror
153321221212.content:
Sunset took one look through the office window to see if she was being watched anymore. When she saw that Celestial had left her seat, her legs sped up their movement. There was no denying that something was odd about all of this and whether Principal Celestia had good intentions or not was no longer a part of the debate. She made her way through the halls back to her locker and fumbled with the combination. Opening up the door, Sunset reached for the book she was looking for: the journal she used to communicate to Twilight. With her nervousness, she began to scribble her message.

Twilight,
Might need you on standby. Principal Celestial is acting a little odd.
Closing the book, Sunset threw it into her backpack and hurried off to tell the girls of her unusual encounter with their Principal.
153321221212.title: What is Sunset up too?

choices: Luna with a tray of brownies
A sweet scent in the room
1533212212121.content:
For the rest of the day, nothing spectacular made itself know to either party in the current events taking place. It wasn't until early morning the next day when things truly began to pick up.

Celestia smiled as she looked around the schoolyard, the grass sparkling with dew and the sunrise showing off glamorous colors. It almost made her wish Luna was outside to see all of this, but her sister was busy at the moment. With a look to her watch, Celestial mumbled to herself. "Should be here any second now...." Sure enough, a strong glow was beginning to from the statue and the mirror connected to it. Celestial grinned as she saw Twilight's form coming out. "Whew...that always takes a lot out me." The principal took a deep breath and tried to give a calm, yet surprised look to her face. "Twilight, what a nice surprise." The purple girl jumped slightly and turned around at the voice. When her eyes met that of Celestial, she took the tinesr step back. "Princc....I mean Principal Celestia. What are you...." "Oh, I was merely enjoying the sunset out here, I didn't realize you would be here." Twilight figure seemed to relax a moment while her eyes still conveyed tensity. "Well...I receive word that there might be a little trouble here." Celestial giggled as best she could. "Oh...I bet Sunset said that. I feel she might have merely overreacted over a simple question I had asked her. I am quite glad you are here though..." With a 'follow me' motion, Celestial asked in the most sugar coated voice she could make. "Would you be a good student and come into my office please?" Celestial saw the girl nod and follow her as she made her way into the school. No one else was there so the only sound the two heard were their own footsteps. In a short time, the two made their way to the office door. As Twilight stepped in, she noticed.....
1533212212121.title: The next day: Twilight comes from the mirror

choices: Why not, they look pretty good
15332122121211.content: "Why sister, I didn't know you baked." Celestial exclaimed as she saw her sister carrying a large tray of brownies. "I really just made them for our guest. I trust nothing seems different since you last came here Miss Twilight?" "Oh..everything's fine Luna...." Twilight looked at Luna for a moment, thinking she saw something. Celestia's voice quickly took Twilight out of her thoughts as the woman sat down at her desk. "Go ahead and have one if you want. We can begin our discussion when you're done." Twilight looked back to Luna, the brownies smelled and looked great for certain....but....something just seemed unusual....
15332122121211.title: Luna with a tray of brownies

choices: She follows them to the school basement
They go into a classroom and lock the door.
153321221212111.content:
Even with her suspicions in place, everything else seemed fine in Twilight's eyes. Taking another look at Luna, Twilight decided the happy expression in her was just from excitement over her being here. "Well....alright then, if you say so Miss Celestia." Picking a brownie off the top of the pile, Twilight popped it into her mouth. The girl marveled the taste, so gooey and sweet and yet slightly crisp. "Mmmmm, these are really good Luna. You really should make more of these." As Twilight took another, Celestia began speaking. "So I believe you said that the reason you came here was that Sunset had said something was wrong." Twilight nodded as she finished swallowing her second bite. "She didn't really explain it, she just said that you were acting unusual." As Twilight bit into her second brownie, she tried to savor this one more compared to her just eating the first one. "Well now, that certainly doesn't seem very descriptive at all. Well, I suppose I should explain myself, you see after you and your friends defeated....." As Celestia kept talking, Twilight's squinted her eyes. It seemed that for a moment everything went blurry before quickly returning back. Twilight polished off her second brownie and felt like she really wanted another despite thinking she had plenty. Her eyes drooped as she felt a strange feeling of numbness enter her head. "Are you alright Twilight?" Celestia said with a devious smile, "You look a little tired. Maybe you should eat another brownie to get some energy." Twilight put a hand to her head, as she attempted to stand up. "No no.....it's just....my head....what was in those....ugh...." "I think you're just tired after your trip Twilight, you need to get some rest." Twilight yawned as she slumped back into her seat, her eyes forcefully closing. "No...I....so tired...." As the purple girl fell asleep in her chair, Celestia looked to the clock and saw there were ten minutes before most students began arriving. "Luna, hide Twilight where she won't be found for the day. The mix we put into your brownies will keep her asleep long enough for school to end." "Yes sister." Luna said in a monotone voice.

(Hours later)

As the end bell rang out through the halls, Sunset did her best to stay hidden from the cameras. She had not seen Twilight at all today and had no notice on her letter. Through these thoughts, she decided something had happened to Twilight and she had a very bad idea about what that something was. Celestia had made an announcement during the day that all student and staff were to leave as quickly as possible after school and that statement had all in question. Quickly ducking into the bathroom, Sunset saw that no one was in. Holding her ear to the door, Sunset listened as the sounds of feet scuffling around quickly quieted.

Celestia looked over the camera feeds and was pleased to see her announcement was met with speed. All the students had left, which meant it was time to move Twilight from her hiding spot. "Come sister, it's time we begin our work for the night." The sisters pulled the still sleeping Twilight from the locked office and began carrying her, unaware of Sunset hearing them as they left the office.
153321221212111.title: Why not, they look pretty good

1533212212121112.content:
Luna & Celestia hold Twilight up by her arms against their shoulders, trying to keep her in a standing position at least. So in case anyone walked by, it wouldn't be "too" suspicious.
As the two were walking to their destination, they were looking all around them, they were looking all around, to make sure no one WAS nearby to see them. Knowing this, Sunset was trying to stay hidden by any means necessary. She was hiding behind corners, behind any open doors to classrooms, even in recycling & trash bins that happened to be nearby.
At last, the ladies found a room to place Twilight, in the band room. "There aren't many students who came into this room since the battle of the bands" Celestia told Luna as she opened the door. "We'll leave her here for now," She said, as they went in.
After they closed the door, Sunset tiptoed over to it, and tried to turn the knob as quietly as possible, but found a problem with that. "Oh crap," she said in grief, "They locked it didn't they..." She tried to check out what was happening through the window, but it was too dark to see anything. "Well it looks like I'll have to find another way in." Sunset said to herself.
1533212212121112.title: They go into a classroom and lock the door.

15332122121211122.content:
After checking the dark paper she put over the window was stationary, Luna went to her sister to help her with Twilight. One would find that by 'help', they were actually wrapping her wrists and ankles to a chair in the center of the room. "Alright, now that our dear Twilight is strapped in place...." Celestia handed a small flash drive to her sister. ".....I need you to put this into the metronome player. Instead of a simple click, we'll give her something she'll find quite.....enthralling." The Vice Principal nodded and did as she was told. "Wait before you start it up though, we need to wait a few moments.....three...two....one...." A slight groaning could be heard from Twilight as the 'special' brownies began to wear off. "Ugghhh....wha.....what?" Twilight looked at the position she was in with frantic eyes, already attempting to struggle from he binds. "Awww...." Celestia said in a mock amused tone, "....your struggling isn't doing anything. How sad." Twilight's head swerved to the principal as her face conveyed a mix of surprise, anger and confusion. "Principal Celestia!? What's going on?! What are you doing?!" Celestia put a hand to Twilight's mouth with a shush. "Before I answer anything, yelling will do nothing for you. This being the band room, there are sound absorbers all along the walls which mean no sound goes outside this room. With that out of the way, you my dear are about to become my favorite student. You see, ever since you came here there was something about you that fascinated me and compelled me to want you here." "So what? You're going to keep me strapped up in this chair forever?" Celestia chuckled. "What? What kind of monster do you take me for? I don't want to torture you, no I think there is a simpler way to do this." With that, Celestia motioned to her sister, who turned on the metronome. As it started, it sounded very much like any other metronome. The drive was beginning to kick in though and soon words could faintly be heard.

Obey.....me....obey....Celestia......obey......me.....

"I have such a voice, don't I?" Celestia said as she walked towards the chair pile and grabbed a chair. Twilight listened to the metronome before giggling slightly. "You think this is going to work on me? Just a simple metronome?" "It worked on Luna and she never noticed, but it's not just the metronome for you, oh no." As Celestia pulled a seat in front of Twilight, she continued. "You see, you are somewhat easy to figure out. You are someone who has little true will to themselves. You are constantly given tasks by others and you follow and you do everything you can to keep from falling behind or failing. Your mind will constantly follow the metronome without you knowing it." "Well, it will take more then that to do whatever it is you plan on doing to....." Twilight's mouth hung in realization......already her speech was attempting to be in time with the words of the metronome. Celestia pulled out a small screen and began typing into it. "Now that you have established your predicament, it is time to make you mine." Flipping the small screen over to show a green spiral, Celestia said. "Now be a good student and look into the spiral." The metronome effects were already in place as Twilight could not resist looking into the hypnotic spiral.
15332122121211122.title: On Celestia's & Luna's POV

153321221212111222.content:
The flow of the spiral going straight toward Twilight's eyes was at first making her feel more dizzy than since she started, but the pace of the metronome's ticking was helping her to calm down. Twilight was trying hard to keep her eyes open for as long as possible, for if she closed them, for even a second, she could fall as a victim to Principal Celestia's plan.
She blinked once, which went on a tad longer than it should've, her eyes then quickly sprung open toward the spiral again. The pattern went on until it got to the point where her eyes could no longer open them, then suddenly, her head started to droop, her long hair was starting to touch the floor.
"Success! She's out." Celestia said in a victorious, but also quiet tone. "Twilight, can you hear me?" Celestia asked her. "Y-YYes." Was all Twilight could say. Principal Celestia turned toward Luna with a sinister look on her face. "I think we're ready Luna," Celestia said to her, "indeed sister." Luna said in her monotone voice.
153321221212111222.title: Twilight tries to resist

"Twilight, I want you to listen to what I am about to tell you as it is very important for you. I now have you under my control which means you have to do all that I tell you, although I don't think it will be too much trouble. You will obey me and only me or those who I allow control over you, but you won't think you do it because you are entranced. You will do it because you wish to be my favorite student, to receive my admiration and please me. You will study as hard as you can to show your intelligence to me and your only big desire is to make me happy. Do you understand?" In the same voice as before, Twilight said "Yesss." "Good....however, I want you to know getting grades is not the only way to please me. You could simply stay by my side, obeying my words and loving nothing else.....maybe except for one thing...." Celestia bit her lip, the thoughts from before coming up once more. After motioning Luna to cover her ears, Celestia put a hand to Twilight's cheek. "You cannot explain it, but the very sight of me fills you with an odd emotion. An emotion you will not be able to control and helps guide you towards obeying me. When we are alone in the future, you will talk to me about this emotion and the conclusion you came up for what it is: Love. You will believe it is nothing to be ashamed off and declare it for me there." With a soft smirk, Celestia now cradled Twilight's whole face in two hands. "You obey me, you belong to me, and you love me." "o..bey....b-elong....lo-ve." Twilight mumbled. "Now, I am going to wake you up in a moment. Afterwards, you will seem like your normal self but with everything I've told you in your mind. The feelings and urges, you've had those ever since we first met." Celestia began to untie Twilight's braces as she motioned Luna to uncover her ears. "Now Twilight, when I count to three, you will awaken and everything I have told you will be true in your mind. You will have no recollection of this hypnosis session and will ask me what you have been doing. One....two.....three...." As Celestia said three, Twilight began to stir in her chair. She brought her head up ad her eyes twinkled at the sight of Principal Celestia. "Oh, Principal.....wh...what are we doing here?" "You had said you were stressed out so Luna and I played you a relaxing melody. You must have fell asleep." "Oh...well I certainly feel relaxed Principal Celestia." Celestia put a hand to Twilight's cheek and softly said, "Anything for my favorite student." Twilight blushed, Celestia's hand on her face gave a feeling a happiness across her mind.

1533212221.content:
Principal Celestia coughed as she she waved away the dust that had just been kicked up. "I really need Luna's help for this. Better yet, I think some of the student's would be more than happy to help clear this out." The woman had been up in the old school storeroom, deciding it was well over time to give the room a cleaning. Junk, broken decorations and bric-a-brac everywhere and not one bit of it had been touched on years. Except maybe for when she realized Sunset had been sleeping here before her big change but even then there was a load of dust. Wiping the sweat from her forehead, Celestia decided she needed to catch her breath and so sat down on one of the large crates behind her. Taking a look around the room, Celestia sighed. "No doubt about it, there will be student's looking for extra credit." She lifted herself off the crate only to stop mid push. A glinting object seemed to be poking out of the otherwise unwanted rubbish. "What...hmm..." Celestia didn't know why, but the handle she saw was just asking for her to grab it. Taking one hand on the structure, the woman have a firm hug and the object was freed from the pile. Taking a good look at what she now held in her hands, Celeste was surprised to see what looked like an old arabian style lamp. "Hmm..this must have been a play prop. Doesn't seem too damaged." Celeste was right, the lamp appeared nearly untouched by the specks of time around it. Of course, there was quite a bit of dust anyways. Decideing there was no harm to it, Celestia decided to see what a good run would do for the object's look. With one run though, blue smoke poured from the top and began to swirl around the Principal. It quickly enveloped her and Celestia had nothing to stop what was about to happen to her.....

.....or to Canterlot High for that matter.
1533212221.title: Interesting...continue....

15332122211.content:
*Click* *Clink*

15333122.content:
Twilight groaned as she trudged through the stream, messing up the boots Rarity made for her a while ago. It didn't help that she had to crouch low into the mud of the stream. In science class, the homework many of the classes had involved collecting a list of mosses, leaves and other specimens. One problem known to Twilight was that while the listed objects could be found in any meadow around town, the best examples were found on the edge of the forest. She didn't bother asking her friends to come with her because she knew they'd say no. Most of the students either spoke fearfully of the forest and it's rumored inhabitant or wanted nothing to do with it. With the thought of a good grade however, she wasn't about to let rumors frighten her off. She kept following and wading through the stream, unaware of two yellow lights watching her from the darkness of the treeline.

"Come on..." Twilight groaned, "Were is that moss? I should have found some of it by now." She had been following the stream for a while and her legs were starting to feel cramped. She stood up to relax....only to find a sight that really freaked her out. There was nothing but trees surrounding her. She was certain the stream only ran through the edge of the forest when she started. "No problem..." Twilight said in a somewhat-calm tone, "I'll just follow the stream back out." She turned around.....only to see multiple branching paths in the stream. With a sigh, she picked one and went.

(Several hours and multiple failed follows later)

If Twilight wasn't doing everything she could to keep herself calm, she'd be crying. Every path she followed only brought her to a dead end, or worse a similar point in the stream. She had no clue where she was and to top it all off, she didn't bring her phone. "I'm lost...." she whispered, fear and worry finally taking her.

"I can tell you're full of fear, would you like me to help you here?" The voice startled Twilight, though she was happy to hear anyone. She looked around for the source of the voice and saw two yellow lights in the shadows. "Come with me and it'll be alright, you could say I'd be your guiding light." The figure stepped closer, allowing Twilight to see her full body cloak. "Zecora is who I be, now will you follow me?" "Yes." Twilight said "Please help me." Zecora chuckled as her eyes glowed even brighter. Before Twilight could do anything, the glow filled her vision. She fell to the ground asleep.

You're new to this school. You've heard on the news about this school having a "magical incident" or something like that recently, but you shrug it off as the news just being the news and over exaggerating a bit.

Walking through the halls, you get to your locker: 665.

There's no lock in it (yet) and there's nothing in there, either...

Except for some weird object with a blank post-it-note attached to it.
Removing the blank post-it note, you look at the object closely.
What is it? you wonder.
Looking closely, you notice Hypnotizer printed on it in gold.
You scratch your head wondering how a hypnotizer got in your locker.
Maybe there's something to this magic thing...
You put it into your pocket, pretty sure there's nothing to it and it's just a prank.
"Hi!" some pink-haired, pink-skinned girl says to you as she seemingly comes out of nowhere and catches you off guard.
"I'm Pinkie Pie!" she says before you can respond. She extends her hand. "And you are?"
"Uh... Y/N..." you say, hesitantly reaching out to her hand.
"Hi, Y/N!" she says, shaking your hand seemingly faster than light.
"So, uh, I'm-" you start to say.
"New? I know, silly!" she interrupts. "You see, I know because i know everyone in the school, andifthere'safaceI'mnotfamiliarwithIjustknowthey'renew-"
"Are you hear to show me around the school?" you ask, as politely as you can.
"Oh, yeah!" she says. "Lemme show you around!"
As you get shown around the school by Pinkie Pie, you two have a blast together and end up walking home together.
She comes over to your house as you both know each of your parents wouldn't mind (your parents aren't home), and you talk and chat and have a good time.
At one point, the conversation stops, and she asks, "Whuddya wanna do now?"
Suddenly, the "Hypnotizer" comes to your mind. You suddenly want to hypnotize Pinkie.
You shouldn't.
You couldn't.
It wouldn't work!
Somehow, you still find yourself pressing some button on it.
Her eyes seem to widen and focus on you. She gets on her knees and says, "What can I do for you, master?"
Wow.
It worked.
IT WORKED.
Now that you have her in your control, what do you do?

153332222131.content:
Principal Celestia sat at her desk working away at the papers set in front of her. This was the one thing she hated about being a principal and boy did she find it annoying. Pushing the thought from her head Celestial tried to put focus back on her work. Hearing a few knocks from the office door, Celestial quietly sighed in relief as she set her pen down. "Come in!" Her sister Luna came in holding a clipboard with three figures behind her. "Sister, the new students coming here have requested to see you." Celestial looked to some papers in her pile and did indeed see three admission papers. "Ah yes...Adagio Dazzle, Sonata Dusk, and Aria Blaze. How are you three liking our school so far?" "It's really quite something Miss Celestial. However, there is something my friends and I have found quite a problem...." "We have?" Sonata's comment on Adagio's word was met with a quick backhand from Aria. "Oh...yeah...there was something..." Celestia looked back to Adagio. "Well, if there is anything we can do to help you three feel welcome, we would be happy to help." The three girls smirked to one another before opening their mouths.

Ahhh..ahhh..ahhh...ahh

Within those first few cords, Celestia and Luna's eyes shimmered green as their eyelids half closed.

As Sonata and Aria kept their pitches, Adagio crept forward to Celestial while pushing Luna to her. "You see Dear Principal, my...sisters...and I have found there to be quite an odd ratio of girls to boys. Not only that, but all the guys are either huge jerks or too wimpy to mean anything." "Of course.." Celestial said in a hypnotized voice. "Yes, now we were thinking what to do for the case of a love emergency...and we were thinking....well...why not allow...certain parties to intermingle? Do you understand?" "Yes miss Adagio...in fact my female students are being suspected of it already...." "Perfect. There is nothing wrong with admiring one of the same gender. I mean look at you two...can you honestly tell me you never thought about it? Cause I think you should. Who needs those worthless guys anyway?" Adagio stood up and signaled the others to stop singing. "Now...we would like to go to lunch. I do believe that's the current period." "Go right ahead...my sister and I now have things to discuss." The three girls felt the pink mist flow from the two and into the pendants on their necks. A mist that only grew thicker as the three stepped out to give Celestial and Luna privacy

1533322221321.content:
Aria sucked into the room, her self pride having long been drained from her. The wooden door behind her didn't shut all the way, as it had done ever since they bought the apartment. Sonata was draped across the torn and grimy couch, flipping through the television channels. So far, the only things she found were the news reports and different patterns of static. "How much today?" Adagio's voice came from the doorless bathroom without a touch of comfort. Aria sighed as she took off her hat and layed a small hand full of bills and coins on the end table. "Eight dollars and two cents. Barely enough to cover our rent this week." Adagio exited the bathroom with a can of insecticide dangling from her hands. Her once poofy and curly hair sagging and oily from a lack of washing. "Therefore not enough to get the water running again. I swear I just hate this dump." Ever the optimisitc, Sonata turned to her friends/sisters and tried keeping thier spirits up. "Well, we are still lucky to have this dump. The landlord was understanding enough to let us stay here even after the months we 'convinced' him to let us stay for free." "But that was in a room with actual beds, running water and a bathroom that wasn't infested with roaches and spiders." All three former sirens sighed. Everything just went downhill for the poor girls after that faithful night against those darn Rainbooms. "I just wish there was some way we could start over." Sonata whined as she finally turned the tv off. Aria rolled her eyes while Adagio stepped towards the girl. "We've been over this Sonata, our necklaces which gave us our hypnotic abilities are gone. It's not like something to replace them is going to fall from the sky. Now turn off that thing before you go over our maximum time." "But I did...." The three girls watched with curiosity as the tv began to rattle and shake. The picture changed repeatedly despite no inputs to do so, the audio creating a blur of white noise. Eventually it all stopped, with a large wooden chest popping out of the screen. Sonata jumped off the couch, leaving a spring to pop out and looked over the object. "Hey girls, there's a note here....for us!" Aria and Adagio followed behind and read the inscription.
Dear Adagio, Aria, and Sonata,
Within this chest lies your hope and salvation from the squalor you're in.
"Open the chest and you will find....." Without finishing the sentence, Sonata opened up the chest. Between the slight cracks flew three red gems which, upon reaching the girls, former into necklaces. As if by magics, the girls were coated in a bright light as thier beauty and clothing were restored. None of the Dazzlings knew quite what to say, and instead continued to read what was on the chest.
In addition to restored versions of your gems, I have included a new world for you three to play in. Jump into this chest and you will be taken to a world similar to the way it was before you began your assault of Canterlot. The difference however will not only be your intelligence over the situation, but also the way your powers work. You will not only have your voices, but certain objects I have enchanted for your use. Also,
You should now be able to 'upgrade' your powers based upon how many people are subservient to you. Good luck Dazzlings.

Without hesitation, each of the girls dived into the chest. Upon doing so, the chest vanished without a trace of knowledge that either it or the Dazzlings were ever in the room.

info.brief_description: The Characters from Equestria Girls are hypnotized. The possibilities are endless!
info.description:
Gift Points will be rewarded for every addition.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
After the Fall Formal at Canterlot High, some students have been getting interested in hypnosis and mind control after Sunset Shimmer brainwashed the whole school. Any MLP character can be added into this story, (even if they weren't in any on the Equestria Girls movies.) Add any chapters.

When a character is hypnotized/brainwashed, they can do anything.

Strip, dance, have sex with another character (Just don't go too far or too into detail,) etc. The only thing not allowed is vore. After all, this is Equestria Girls not lamias.

Go ahead and add some chapters. Have fun ;)
